meta.article_title: Make a Game of Your Weaknesses

terminologie_extrait.definition: a shot played with the back of the racket
terminologie_extrait.contexte: used in a game to improve weak backhands

debutant.description: play backhand drives to improve weak backhands

exercices_complementaires.description: play backhand-to-backhand games with a box or towel around the middle of the table to keep the ball in play

metriques_progression: repeat for 10-15 minutes, take a break, repeat
erreurs_a_eviter: playing anything other than a backhand drive

debutant.description: play a game where one player loops everything, the other blocks

exercices_complementaires.description: play a game where one player loops everything, the other blocks; alternate version: blocker can smash or counterloop if he sees a weak loop

metriques_progression: repeat for 10-15 minutes, take a break, repeat
erreurs_a_eviter: playing anything other than loop or block

debutant.description: play an all-pushing game with someone

exercices_complementaires.description: take turns serving short backspin, pushing short; if a push is going to go long, let it go and win the point; if it bounces twice, lose the point

metriques_progression: repeat for 10-15 minutes, take a break, repeat
erreurs_a_eviter: missing a push or popping it up

debutant.description: play a regular game except both players are allowed only two shots after the serve to win the point

exercices_complementaires.description: play a regular game except both players are allowed only two shots after the serve to win the point; look for ways to stop the opponent's attack on his serve

metriques_progression: repeat for 10-15 minutes, take a break, repeat
erreurs_a_eviter: not being aggressive enough on the serve
